On Medicare For All, progressives must exert the pressure to force change. I admire the activists who are pushing us.
There is an apocryphal story that aptly describes FDR’s approach to politics. When activists suggested a bold proposal, FDR agreed and said: “go out and make me do it.”

No single election will pass Medicare For All. Electing more Democrats will not, by itself, be enough. Only a sustained, mass movement pushing from the outside and allies pushing on the inside can make single-payer a reality.

As a start, we must deliver on what @POTUS campaigned on —a public option, lowering the Medicare eligibility age to 60, and expanding Medicaid in the 11 states where the GOP is cruelly, cynically obstructing it.

Passing Medicare For All is a generational struggle. I pledge to keep fighting until single-payer is a reality. That means fighting not only the GOP, but also Democrats who refuse to take on the private insurance industry.

Mental healthcare is healthcare. In addition to passing #MedicareForAll, I will work to ensure mental health parity. We need to provide funding to address the shortage of providers and ensure psych meds (including Adderall) are available/fully covered.

100 million Americans are drowning in medical debt. No one should have to go into debt, much less medical bankruptcy, for getting sick in the richest country in the world. We have a moral obligation to #cancelmedicaldebt.

Millions of Americans are either uninsured or underinsured. One of the reasons I endorsed @BernieSanders twice and co-chaired his campaign in 2020 was his commitment to ending this injustice with #MedicareForAll.

THREAD: The Affordable Care Act is a historic achievement. But it was never intended as an end goal. To fulfill the dream of FDR and Harry Truman, to guarantee healthcare as a human right, we must pass
#MedicareForAll.
